page.title: 04MEEND FARM,LYDART
page.content: A Gwent County Council smallholding of 109 acres,the Meend Farm,Lydart, stocks 60 ewes and 100 cattle. Out to pasture from mid April to early November,the cattle are housed during the winter months in covered yards. Although hay normally provides the bulk of winter fodder at The Meend,the wet summer of 1985 proved disastrous for haymaking. Many farms turned from hay to big bale silage as a means of salvaging grass crops from wet fields. By early September the resultant sharp increase in demand for plastic silage bags caused a shortage of supplies in the area. Farm machinery depots experienced a similar rise in demand for new and secondhand round balers and the necessary bale handling equipment. For The Meend,as for many neighbouring farms,1985 has been the year of the big bag !
